meanings.sent1: The cat's flexed tail showed its irritation.
meanings.sent2: She admired the flexed muscles of the gymnast.
meanings.sent3: The flexed tree branch looked like it was trying to touch the ground.
meanings.sent4: The flexed wire was as taut as a bowstring.
meanings.sent5: The flexed rubber band snapped back with force.

meanings.definition: To exhibit or show off one's muscles
meanings.sent1: He flexed his biceps to impress his friends.
meanings.sent2: She always flexed before starting her workout.
meanings.sent3: The bodybuilder flexed in front of the mirror, admiring his own muscles.
meanings.sent4: The wrestler flexed his muscles like a proud peacock.
meanings.sent5: The superhero flexed before taking on the villain.

meanings.definition: To move or contract a muscle or body part
meanings.sent1: She flexed her fingers before playing the piano.
meanings.sent2: He flexed his toes to relieve the cramp.
meanings.sent3: The dancer flexed her legs gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The athlete flexed his knee before the race.
meanings.sent5: The baby flexed its chubby arms in excitement.
